member.name: T:EnvDTE100.Debugger5
member.summary: is used to interrogate and manipulate the state of the debugger and the program being debugged. supersedes the interface.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.AllBreakpointsLastHit
member.summary: Gets a collection of bound breakpoints that were last simultaneously hit.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Break(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the given process to pause its execution so that its current state can be analyzed.
member.param: Set to true to return only when the debugger has entered break mode. Set to false to break and return immediately. See How to: Break Execution for more information.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.BreakpointLastHit
member.summary: Gets the last breakpoint hit. To get a collection of multiple breakpoints hit simultaneously, see .

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Breakpoints
member.summary: Gets a collection of breakpoints.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.CurrentMode
member.summary: Gets the current mode of the debugger within the context of the IDE.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.CurrentProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the active process.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.CurrentProgram
member.summary: Sets or returns the active program.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.CurrentStackFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the current stack frame.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.CurrentThread
member.summary: Gets or sets the current thread being debugged.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.DebuggedProcesses
member.summary: Gets the list of processes that are currently being debugged.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.DeleteObjectID(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the object ID.
member.param: The object ID.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.DetachAll
member.summary: Detaches from all attached programs.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.ExceptionGroups
member.summary: Gets the exception settings for the debugger. For each exception, these settings determine whether the debugger gives the code a chance to handle the exception before the debugger breaks execution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.ExecuteStatement(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the specified statement. If the flag is true, then the string is interpreted as an expression, and output is sent to the Command Window.
member.param: The statement to execute.
The timeout period, in milliseconds.
true if the string is to be interpreted as an expression; otherwise false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.ExportBreakpoints(System.String)
member.summary: Exports the breakpoints to a file.
member.param: The file name.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.ForceContinue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the debugger breaks or continues when a tracepoint or breakpoint finishes executing a macro. The default behavior is set by the user in the dialog box when the tracepoint or breakpoint is created. This property can be used to change the default behavior.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if continuation will be forced; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.GetExpression(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates an expression based on the current stack frame. If the expression can be parsed but not evaluated, an object is returned but does not contain a valid value.
member.param: The expression text to be evaluated.
true if the auto-expand rules should be used; otherwise, false.
The timeout period in milliseconds.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.GetExpression2(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates an expression based on the current stack frame. If the expression can be parsed but not evaluated, an object is returned but does not contain a valid value. This method is similar to but with an additional Boolean parameter, which can be set to true to indicate that the expression is to be evaluated as a statement.
member.param: The expression text to be evaluated.
true if the auto-expand rules should be used; otherwise, false.
true if the expression text should be treated as a single statement; otherwise, false.
The timeout period in milliseconds.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.GetExpression3(System.String,EnvDTE.StackFrame,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Evaluates an expression, similar to . However, this method allows the caller to specify the stack frame that the evaluation will occur on. It also allows the caller to specify whether automatic evaluation of properties and implicit function calls should occur.
member.param: The expression text to be evaluated.
The stack frame where the expression is to be evaluated. This stack frame can be in any thread of any process that is currently being debugged, if and only if the process is in break mode.
true if the auto-expand rules should be used; otherwise, false.
true if the expression text should be treated as a single statement; otherwise, false.
true if automatic evaluation of properties and implicit function calls should be performed; otherwise, false.
The timeout period in milliseconds.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.GetProcesses(EnvDTE80.Transport,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object that represents the processes that are currently connected for debugging on the specified transport.
member.param: A transport type or protocol that is used by the debugger to communicate with the computer that is running the process being debugged. See .
A qualifier for the transport type. See .

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Go(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts executing the program from the current statement.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return, the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes. See Execution Control for more information.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.HexDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expressions are output in hexadecimal or decimal format.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if hexadecimal format; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.HexInputMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the expressions are evaluated in hexadecimal or decimal format.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if hexadecimal format; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.ImportBreakpoints(System.String)
member.summary: Imports breakpoints from a file.
member.param: The file name.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Languages
member.summary: Gets a list of languages that the debugger supports.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.LastBreakReason
member.summary: Gets the last reason that a program was broken. If the program is running, it returns DBG_REASON_NONE.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.LocalProcesses
member.summary: Gets the list of processes that are currently running on this computer.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.OnlyLoadSymbolsManually
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether symbols are loaded manually or automatically. The Visual Studio user can determine this setting in the Options dialog box. For more information about how to set this value within Visual Studio, see How to: Specify Symbol Locations and Loading Behavior.
member.returns: A Boolean that is true if symbols must be loaded manually; false if symbols are loaded automatically.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object ().

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.RunToCursor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the program to the current position of the source file cursor.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.See Code Stepping Overview for more information.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.SetNextStatement
member.summary: Sets the next instruction to be executed, according to the cursor position in the current source file.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.SetSymbolSettings(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets various settings for the .PDB symbols used by Visual Studio for debugging and forces reloading of all symbols.
member.param: The path to the location of the .PDB symbol files.
A string that contains one character for each symbol path. If the symbol path is enabled, the character has a value of "1". If the symbol path not enabled, the character can have any other value.
The path to the location of the cache used for downloading symbols from a symbol server.
Set to true if symbols should only be loaded manually, false if symbols should be loaded automatically.
Set to true if symbols should be loaded immediately; otherwise false.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.StepInto(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps into the next function call, if possible.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run-mode.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.StepOut(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps out of the current function.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.StepOver(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Steps over the next function call.
member.param: Set to true if this function call should wait until either Break mode or Design mode is entered before returning. Set to false if you want this call to return immediately after causing the debugger to begin execution. Upon return the debugger could be in Design, Break, or Run modes.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops debugging and terminates or detaches from all attached processes.
member.param: Set to true if the debugging session should stop only when it reaches Design mode. Set to false if you intend to stop debugging, but you have to perform other tasks in the macro before the debugger enters design mode.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.SymbolCachePath
member.summary: Gets a string that contains the path to the symbols cache used by Visual Studio when you download symbols from a symbols server. You can specify the symbols cache path in the Options dialog box. For more information, see How to: Use a Symbol Server.
member.returns: A string that contains the path to the symbols cache.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.SymbolPath
member.summary: Gets a string that contains paths to .PDB symbol files that are used by Visual Studio for debugging. The Visual Studio user can specify symbols paths in the Options dialog box. For more information, see How to: Specify Symbol Locations and Loading Behavior.
member.returns: A string that contains a semicolon delimited list of paths to the .PDB symbol files.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.SymbolPathState
member.summary: Gets a string that represents the state of all symbol paths for the .PDB symbol files that are used by Visual Studio for debugging.
member.returns: A string that contains one character for each symbol path. If the symbol path is enabled, the character has a value of "1". If the symbol path not enabled, the character can have any other value.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.TerminateAll
member.summary: Terminates all currently running debugging processes.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.Transports
member.summary: Gets a collection of supported debugging transports.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Debugger5.WriteMinidump(System.String,EnvDTE80.dbgMinidumpOption)
member.summary: If debugging a program and in Break mode, this function creates a minidump of the current debugging session.
member.param: The file name of the program being debugged.
A constant specifying whether a full or normal dump is written.

member.summary: The object contains properties used to examine items returned by an expression evaluation.

member.summary: Gets the collection containing the object supporting this property or contained within this code construct.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.DataMembers
member.summary: If the expression represents a class or a structure, this property gets a list of member variables as an collection.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.IsValidValue
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified value in an expression is valid.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Expression2.MakeObjectID
member.summary: Creates the object ID.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the object.
member.returns: A string representing the object's name.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of an object.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.Type
member.summary: Gets a constant indicating the object type.
member.returns: A string constant representing the object type.

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Expression2.Value
member.summary: Sets or gets the data for the object.
member.returns: A string representing the value of the object.

member.name: T:EnvDTE100.Solution4
member.summary: Represents all projects and solution-wide properties in the integrated development environment (IDE). Supersedes , , and .

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Solution4.AddFromFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a project to the solution that is based on a project file already stored in the system.
member.param: Required. The full path and file name of the project file.

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own solution; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Solution4.AddFromTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies an existing project file, and any items or subdirectories it contains, to the specified location and adds it to the solution.
member.param: Required. The full path and file name with extension of the template project file.
Required. The full path of the directory in which to copy the contents of .
Required. The name of the project file in the destination directory. This should include the extension. The displayed name is derived from .

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Solution4.AddFromTemplateEx(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Copies an existing project file, and any items or subdirectories it contains, to the specified location and adds it to the solution.
member.param: Required. The full path and file name with extension of the template project file.
Required. The full path of the directory in which to copy the contents of .
Required. The name of the project file in the destination directory. This should include the extension. The displayed name is derived from .

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.

Optional. Indicates whether the project loads in the current solution or its own; true if the current solution is closed and the project is added to a new solution, false if the project is added to the existing, open solution.
The .

member.summary: Adds a solution folder to a collection.

member.name: M:EnvDTE100.Solution4.Close(System.Boolean)

member.name: P:EnvDTE100.Solution4.Count
